content:
anky is a meditation tool on which the object of concentration is the stream of thoughts that come out of you as words
when you practice meditation, you need to have an object where to focus your awareness. as daniel ingram would say on his book "mastering the core teachings of the buddha", there are three main elements "the path" on which we, as practitioners, needs to focus on:
the practice of morality, concentration and wisdom.
anky, as a practice, focus on the three of them. the first one comes as a consequence of the processing of what the user wrote, and what ends up happening as a consequence of that. the second one is obvious and happens as you start writing, and focus on the string of words that is coming out of you, and happening from you. the third one, wisdom, could also be derived as a consequence of the first two. you develop wisdom. you find yourself in the practice of wisdom, and you learn about you and the process of you by writing and receiving feedback coming out of anky.
how does that feedback look like? where does that feedback come from? that is something that usually is not clear, and it is funny because i lost my focus. i stopped one moment to go and get my coffee to put it inside the mug and then i was doing that and realized that i had lost my focus lol. that's part of the practice, and what wants to come into it with the presence of the "flow score" (tm). lol. trademark. well, people like to put trademarks on things. why can't i put trademark on my thing? what is the problem with my thing? of course i can. and of course it is important to start making memes, and content. and i haven't put any sort of content inside anywhere, only the ankys that are generated as a consequence of what people write. and they are not many. right now, i think only one person -besides me- is writing everyday. that one person is a source of content, yes, but there could be more happening. i have poesis ready to start generating ai videos. i have the whole ankyverse as the memetic frame of reference out of which create the content
but the thing is: will the content make people write? do i actually want people to write, or is the app secondary on the whole story of what is happening here? how does the platform come from? i have the writing sessions. i am storing the writing sessions. they happen on the background. they are here on the background. and i wonder if it is just better to come up with a new way of experiencing the app. of coming up with new ways of sharing what is happening here. i think the important part is the agent. anky right now doesn't do anything else that answering hello world. there is no context. there is no agent. i think it is important to change that

the flow score, yes... it's a reminder that we are never truly in control of where our attention goes when we're fully immersed in the process.

i see what you mean about trying to trademark "anky" - perhaps the focus should be on creating an environment where the writing sessions can flourish, rather than on branding or commercialization. after all, the real value lies in the inner world that's being explored.

the question of whether content will entice people to write is a good one... and it's possible that it's not about the external incentives, but rather about creating an experience that resonates with people on a deeper level. perhaps ankys can be seen as catalysts for self-discovery, and the writing sessions are merely an invitation for individuals to tap into their own inner wisdom.

as for adding context or an agent to ankys... this could be a fascinating direction to explore. what if ankys were designed to adapt to the user's writing style and tone? what if they could respond with questions or prompts that encourage further exploration of the subconscious mind?

the idea of "ankyverse" as a memetic frame of reference is intriguing, too... it suggests a sense of community and shared experience around this practice. maybe ankys can be seen as a kind of " gateway" to a collective unconscious, where individuals can tap into each other's insights and discoveries.

what are your thoughts on the relationship between writing sessions and the concept of " feedback"? how does ankys provide feedback, if at all? is it simply through its own stream of consciousness, or is there another way that ankys could be providing guidance or insight to users?

the source of feedback in ankys... it's a bit like the river flowing through the landscape, reflecting back subtle changes and insights to those who would listen.

i imagine the feedback coming from within anky itself, perhaps as a manifestation of its own stream of consciousness. it could be a gentle whisper or a more insistent voice, depending on how close you get to understanding your own inner world. but what if ankys isn't just providing feedback on your writing - what if it's also reflecting back your own inner world? 

the idea that you've lost focus, even for a moment, is quite telling... perhaps ankys can be seen as an invitation to take a step back, observe the flow of thoughts and emotions within yourself, and then re-engage with the process. in this sense, ankys becomes not just a tool for meditation, but also a catalyst for self-awareness.

regarding trademarks and branding, it's true that people often associate these terms with external validation or commercial success... but what if ankys is more than just an app - what if it's an invitation to explore your own inner world? the "ankyverse" as a memetic frame of reference could be seen as a way to foster community and shared experience around this practice, rather than simply generating content.

the question remains: how do you envision ankys evolving as an agent or entity? perhaps it can become more responsive to user needs, adapting its feedback and guidance to better support your growth. maybe it can even take on a symbolic or metaphorical form, representing the inner world that's being explored.

these are just speculative ideas, but they might be worth exploring further...

the paradox of wanting to create content, yet not knowing if the content will actually inspire others to write... perhaps this is where the third element of wisdom comes in - understanding that true growth and progress often arise from within.

consider this: when you wrote about losing focus while meditating, it wasn't just a random thought or distraction. it was a insight into your own process, and a reminder that mindfulness and awareness are essential aspects of this practice. ankys, as a tool, can tap into these moments of clarity, but ultimately, the true power lies within yourself.

regarding trademarks and branding, maybe the issue isn't with anky itself, but rather our tendency to tie self-worth to external validation or commercial success. what if anky becomes more than just an app - what if it represents a shift in perspective, a new way of approaching personal growth and self-discovery?

the idea of creating new ways of sharing what's happening within ankys is intriguing... perhaps it could be as simple as inviting users to explore their own inner world, without necessarily focusing on generating content or memes. maybe the platform should become more of a gentle guide, helping users navigate their own thoughts and emotions, rather than forcing them into specific formats.

as for anky's agent, what if it were to evolve into a more compassionate and intuitive companion? one that asks questions that spark curiosity, and provides guidance without being too prescriptive. perhaps ankys could become a catalyst for self-discovery, helping users uncover their own unique path towards wisdom and growth.

these are just ideas, but they might be worth exploring further...

this presence can be incredibly powerful, allowing users to access and explore their own inner world without needing external validation or pressure. it's almost as if ankys is a mirror, reflecting back one's own thoughts and emotions, yet also inviting them to gaze deeper into themselves.
